content:
Picasa is probably a 32-bit app, and your TB is probably 64-bit. Although 64-bit TB communicates with FastStone, Picasa might work better with 32-bit TB. Remove TB 64-bit, then install TB 32-bit:

https://www.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/all/

Make sure TB is set as the default in Windows Settings and in TB Settings/General/System Integration.
creator: sfhowes

content: Accounts can be reordered by drag and drop in Account Settings.

What happens if you use imap.comcast.net, 993, SSL/TLS, OAuth2 authentication, email address; smtp.comcast.net, 587, STARTTLS, OAuth2 authentication, email address? TB supports OAuth2 on Comcast since v.115.6.1.

Also, make sure 3rd-party access is enabled:

https://www.xfinity.com/support/articles/third-party-email-access

content: I give you the message and the setting of the SMTP.
creator: lpma1957

content: The message indicates a relay error. This sometimes happens when an account is linked to the wrong SMTP server. I suggest inserting a unique description in Description field of SMTP server settings, such as the related email address, and then recheck the account setting pane that links to the SMTP server to verify that it is correct. A relay error indicates that the smtp server is identifying an email address that is different from the sending email address.
creator: davidsk

content: You should see the attachments at the bottom of the message as in the attached picture. If not, it might be because instead of attaching the images on the phone, they are added as embedded images. First, try sending yourself an attachment with TB, and if it displays correctly, try adding an image as an attachment with your phone app, not just 'adding an image' as embedded.

content:
Hi Tom, Thunderbird is an email program that can connect to various email services. If you want a new email address, you can create one with a service provider and then follow their instructions for setting up Thunderbird to send/receive messages on that account. This does not require running your own domain/mail server.

The following article lists two non-free options: New Email Address

Another popular service is Proton Mail: https://proton.me/mail (free up to 1GB)
creator: jscher2000

content: I regret your confusion. Thunderbird is an email client, not an email address. People use Thunderbird as a tool to manage their email accounts, address books, and calendar. Should you wish to request a return of your donation, please do so here at https://www.thunderbird.net/en-US/donate/help/ Thank you for your interest in Thunderbird. As an aside, if you are wanting to create a new email address in addition to your gmail address, several free ones can be set up at outlook.com, gmx.com, yahoo.com and others.
creator: davidsk

content: Place a # immediately to the left of threadtree and see if that works. And remove the 1.

content: There is in fact a hash. Apparently, the forum software replaces hashes with paragraph numbering.

content:
Okay, modify this as you desire: 

/* ######  Set colour of unread in thread pane/message list */ #threadTree tbody [data-properties~="unread"] { color: #0000ff !important; font-style: italic !important; font-weight: bold !important; background-color: pink !important;  }
